timeline.bodyText: ❗ using finalization is not advisable. In addition, this object will never be GCed since at init time, a timer task is created and registered in the timer. Therefore, there will always be a hard reference to this object which is why it will never be GCed

timeline.author: paouelle

replies.bodyText: Hmm, this should be fine. This destroy method will delete the root folder, which should be safe to get rid of if the object is being destroyed. Everything that accesses that variable is ultimately called by DurableFileSystemFileConsumer, so sincee we're shutting it down in that class I can't see it needing to be used again
